gospel.text:
[[Mt 4,18]]As Jesus was walking by the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon who is called Peter, and his brother Andrew, casting a net into the sea; they were fishermen.
[[Mt 4,19]]He said to them, "Come after me, and I will make you fishers of men."
[[Mt 4,20]]At once they left their nets and followed him.
[[Mt 4,21]]He walked along from there and saw two other brothers, James, the son of Zebedee, and his brother John. They were in a boat, with their father Zebedee, mending their nets. He called them,
[[Mt 4,22]]and immediately they left their boat and their father and followed him.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew

first_reading.text:
[[Rm 10,9]]Brothers and sisters: If you confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
[[Rm 10,10]]For one believes with the heart and so is justified, and one confesses with the mouth and so is saved.
[[Rm 10,11]]For the scripture says, "No one who believes in him will be put to shame."
[[Rm 10,12]]For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek; the same Lord is Lord of all, enriching all who call upon him.
[[Rm 10,13]]For "everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved."
[[Rm 10,14]]But how can they call on him in whom they have not believed? And how can they believe in him of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone to preach?
[[Rm 10,15]]And how can people preach unless they are sent? As it is written, "How beautiful are the feet of those who bring (the) good news!"
[[Rm 10,16]]But not everyone has heeded the good news; for Isaiah says, "Lord, who has believed what was heard from us?"
[[Rm 10,17]]Thus faith comes from what is heard, and what is heard comes through the word of Christ.
[[Rm 10,18]]But I ask, did they not hear? Certainly they did; for "Their voice has gone forth to all the earth, and their words to the ends of the world."
first_reading.title: Letter to the Romans

psalm.text:
[[Ps 19,2]]The heavens declare the glory of God; 
and the firmament proclaims his handiwork.
[[Ps 19,3]]Day pours out the word to day, 
and night to night imparts knowledge.

[[Ps 19,4]]Not a word nor a discourse 
whose voice is not heard;
[[Ps 19,5]]Through all the earth their voice resounds, 
and to the ends of the world, their message.
psalm.title: Psalms
